title.narrative: F.a: LWF Central America Capacity building in resource mobilisation

description.narrative: FCA will exit from the Central America by the end of 2016. In the beginning of 2014, FCA held exit negotiations with its Central American partners and signed MoU on exit with each partner. As the Lutheran World Federation is one of our main partners in the region, the MoU included supporting LWF in strengthening their capacity to find new sources of funding during and beyond FCA?s exit. The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the strengthening of sustainability and continuity of the Central American Programme of the Lutheran World Federation. This is mainly done through enforcing the management of financial resources and especially the capacity of LWF and its local partners in resource mobilisation, fundraising and project/proposal design an d writing. The project will include two components: ? LWF will elaborate a resource management strategy to ensure its sustainability and alternative sources of funding in the region. ? To focus on strengthening the capacity of the LWF and its? partners? st aff in proposal/project design and formulation, fundraising and other issues that the new fundraising and resource management strategy would indicate. The project will focus on increasing and strengthening the skills of the LWF Central America staff (at l east 22 team members from different functions) and local implementing partner staff (21 local organizations) in the four countries of the region.Implementing partner:Lutheran World Federation (LWF) Central America Programme
